data.title: Cinema Smorgasbord – George Kennedy is my Copilot – The Gambler (2014)
data.meta_description: On this episode of GEORGE KENNEDY IS MY COPILOT we're checking out a rare mid-80s George Kennedy commercial for York Heating and Cooling as well as Rupert Wyatt's 2014 remake of the James Toback-written THE GAMBLER, which features the final role of George Kennedy! We discuss Mark Wahlberg's attractiveness, the joys(?) of gambling, whether we would rather have a stereo system or black & white television and SO MUCH MORE! You gotta check it out, you just gotta!
data.text:
https://media.blubrry.com/cinemasmorgasbord/www.cinemasmorgasbord.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/CinemaSmorgasbord-E209-GKIMC.mp3

Download

Find the entire George Kennedy is my Copilot archive right here

On this episode of GEORGE KENNEDY IS MY COPILOT we’re checking out a rare mid-80s George Kennedy commercial for York Heating and Cooling as well as Rupert Wyatt’s 2014 remake of the James Toback-written THE GAMBLER, which features the final role of George Kennedy! We discuss Mark Wahlberg’s attractiveness, the joys(?) of gambling, whether we would rather have a stereo system or black & white television and SO MUCH MORE! You gotta check it out, you just gotta!

Here’s the George Kennedy ad for York Heating and Cooling:

Check out Sarah Jane on Twitter @FookThis, as well as the White Slaves of Chinatown YouTube page. And check out her writing over at the Austin Chronicle right here.
